column4: Hey, just wondering if it is possible to install ubuntu from a USB flash drive that is 256mb (maybe in parts or such)
Yes i know, however I'm wondering if there is a way to load it in parts or load an installer and get the rest over ethernet
if youc an boot a USB device, you might be better off downloading and booting a Debian Etch ISO on that usb device
do you have high speed?
Yes
the Debian Etch 4.0 ISO, is 159mb... it  basically loads the kernel, adn then installs everything else from the internet.
if it detects your internet connection, that would be the way to go in your situation
type this .. "/join #indygunfreak"
so just install it.
so how did you intend to install xubuntu?
can that pc boot a usb thumb drive by chance?..
I have tried
i understand that, but can it boot a USB drive?
like a thumb drive, or flash drive.
then there's your answer, get a thumb drive, and boot the iso off of it... you'll probably need one at least 800mb.
I told you I tried that and it couldn't find the ISO for some unknown reason
oh.
it probably wasn't on there as an image
lol, ok.. well, i don't know...  maybe you could do a debian etch floppy install?
have you looked intot hat option?
* Private messages from unregistered users are currently blocked due to spam problems, but you can always message a staffer. Please register! ( http://freenode.net/faq.shtml#privmsg )
oh, so you're not registered
No I hardly come here
type this w/o quotes  i just have some questions.. "/join #indygunfreak"
